body_html:
Thanks @tatatodd for the labeling and assigning, and thanks @wolffg for the info. For docs_src fixes, I'll limit the domain of each pull request to sibling files (should provide the right level of granularity for the pull requests; let me know if you think this is too coarse-grained), and I'll let the Adding an Op code files be. It appears that the latter is starting to get attention: #8044.

I'm hoping to provide consistent useful contributions to TensorFlow, both via bug fixes and feature additions, once I feel very comfortable with the code base. In the meantime, I thought that fixing documentation errors and other minor issues would be a good way to help out!

Edit: It looks like the Adding an Op code has been taken care of via #8066, thanks @jhseu!

Thanks @tatatodd for the labeling and assigning, and thanks @wolffg for the info.  For docs_src fixes, I'll limit the domain of each pull request to sibling files (should provide the right level of granularity for the pull requests; let me know if you think this is too coarse-grained), and I'll let the Adding an Op code files be.  It appears that the latter is starting to get attention: #8044.

I'm hoping to provide consistent useful contributions to TensorFlow, both via bug fixes and feature additions, once I feel very comfortable with the code base.  In the meantime, I thought that fixing documentation errors and other minor issues would be a good way to help out!
